definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: In other words, banned books are sometimes readily available.
sentences.chinese: 換句話說，禁書有時也是垂手可得的。

sentences.english: So, in lieu of books, the new trend seems to be banning fat.
sentences.chinese: 於是，繼禁書之後，新的趨勢似乎是要禁脂肪。

sentences.english: We are fond of reading but there are still illiterates they must be consent to banning the book.
sentences.chinese: 我們愛讀書，還有不識字的人呢，他們準贊成禁書。

sentences.english: The commissar insisted on indexing the book.
sentences.chinese: 政委堅持將此書列爲禁書。

sentences.english: Jiang Jieshi has also implemented the policy he banned, banned the book not less than.
sentences.chinese: 蔣介石也實行禁書政策，他查禁的書不會少於清朝。

sentences.english: If there is no" price policy", is not the" pleasure".
sentences.chinese: 如果沒有“禁書政策”，是不會產生這種“樂事”的。

sentences.english: Chin Shengt'an regards reading a banned book behind closed doors on a snowy night as one of the greatest pleasures of life.
sentences.chinese: 金聖嘆認爲雪夜閉戶讀禁書，是人生最大的樂趣。

sentences.english: We love books, but there still are many who can’t read and certainly they agree on banning books.
sentences.chinese: 我們愛讀書，還有不識字的人呢，他們準贊成禁書。

sentences.english: So" on door read banned" became a feudal era.
sentences.chinese: 所以“雪夜閉門讀禁書”成爲封建時代一大樂事。

definition: Guwen Guanzhi, an anthology of essays written in Literary Chinese, compiled and edited by Wu Chucai and Wu Diaohou of Qing dynasty
to abridge/to cut a text down to size for publication
name of a book/reputation as calligrapher
folk art consisting of storytelling to music
dictionary/also written 詞典|词典[ci2 dian3]/CL:本[ben3],部[bu4]
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to give a detailed exposition/to state in detail
